item.title: Javascript Async Examples
item.description: Error propagatioon It is not necessary to async function foo() { let rand = ~~(Math.random() * 10); if (rand % 2) { return "Hello"; } else throw Error("Error at foo!"); } async function bar() { let x = await foo(); x += " world"; return x; } async function baz() { let y = await bar(); y += "!!!"; return y; } let a = 0; (async () => { for (let i = 0; i < 10; i++) { try { res = await baz(); console.
